page.title: 03Faulkland
page.content: Faulkland Green is the only unenclosed open space in the parish, though there was another unenclosed are on Faulkland Knoll until the early 19th century when it was divided into allotments. The stocks on the Green are almost certainly a 19th century copy of earlier ones. the only public or community buildings in the village are the Methodist chapel and the village hall, which was once the school. There are very few even pre-19th century buildings in the village, and these are on or close to the Green. Of the 99 houses in Faulkland, the tenure is: local authority 47 owner occupied 6 private rented 6 agricultural tenancy 4 holiday let 1 housing association 1
